Title: gThumb: Arbitrary code execution
Synopsis:
A buffer overflow in gThumb might allow remote attacker(s) to
    execute arbitrary code.

Background.Text: gThumb is an image viewer and browser for GNOME.

Description.Text: A heap-based buffer overflow in gThumbâ€™s _cairo_image_surface_create_from_jpeg() function, located in extensions/cairo_io/cairo-image-surface-jpeg.c was discovered.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted image file using gThumb, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All gThumb users should upgrade to the latest version:
